value.title: Get started with SPARK in Azure Synapse Analytics
value.excerpt: Using Spark in Azure Synapse Analytics opens up a lot of possibilities to work with your data. Venk joins us to get you started with setting it up and quickly using data.  Connect with Venk: https://www.linkedin.com/in/venkatesh-titte-4907467/  Apache Spark in Azure Synapse Analytics https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/synapse-analytics/spark/apache-spark-overview

value.title: Here's a BANANAS report design idea!
value.excerpt: There are many things you can do in a Power BI report that aren't super complex. Here are a few ideas to get you thinking! If Adam can do this, you definitely can! value.title: Power BI dataflows vs datamarts: What's the difference???

value.title: Conditional Column in Power BI using Power Query   You can do anything
value.excerpt: There are many scenarios that you might want to implement a conditional expression. When the conditional expression's logic is on a row-by-row basis, the best is doing it in Power Query rather than DAX (there are exceptions always), The Add Conditional Column in Power Query is a very helpful option,

This type of connection is only supported by a limited number of data sources, and mainly targets systems with a huge amount of

value.title: Drill Down and Up in Power BI Explained
value.excerpt: Power BI works with hierarchies very easily, and there are buttons to drill down and up. However, sometimes, these buttons are confusing for the users. It is essential to know what each drill down/up option is and how it works, not just for developers but also for the end-users. In this blog and video,

value.title: Exception Reporting in Power BI Catch the Error Rows in Power Query
value.excerpt: To build a robust BI system, you need to cater for errors and handle errors carefully. If you build a reporting solution that the refresh of that fails everytime an error occurs, it is not a robust system. Errors can happen by many reasons, In this video, I’ll show you a way to catch potential errors

value.title: How to IMPORT data from a Power BI dataset   Premium only
value.excerpt: Get data from a Power BI dataset is creating a live connection, which is the recommended way because you will get the entire model. value.title: Power BI Get Data from Google Sheets
value.excerpt: Power BI can get data from Google Sheet now. This functionality is released just yesterday and announced in both Power BI and Power Query blogs. value.title: Replace BLANK with Zero in Power BI Visuals Such as Card
value.excerpt: If you use a field in a visual and based on a combination of slicer selection, that field doesn't have any value, you might see blank in the visual. If you want to replace that blank to zero, here is a trick for you. a very simple trick that you can use anywhere easily. Read more details in my blog post,

value.title: Sentiment Colors for Gauge Visual in Power BI
value.excerpt: Gauge Visual is a great visual for KPIs, however, the Gauge visual in Power BI doesn’t have the sentiment colors as an option. Sentiment colors make a gauge much more understandable, you can easily find out is the value high, low, or in the mid-range. Fortunately, there is conditional formatting that
